content.question:
<math alttext="2 N O, gas, plus O 2, gas, is in equilibrium with 2 N O 2, gas. Delta H is less than 0." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>NO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mtd><mtd><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>H</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>
Which of the following changes will increase the amount of <math alttext="N O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> in the reaction system at equilibrium represented above?

choices.label: Adding a catalyst to the reaction system

Increasing the pressure by adding <math alttext="N e, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ne</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> to the system at constant temperature
Increasing the temperature at constant volume
Decreasing the volume at constant temperature

content.answer: Decreasing the volume at constant temperature

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
